Covariance functions¶

  • LinearCov
  • SumCov
  • EyeCov

Linear covariance¶

class limix_inference.cov.LinearCov[source]¶

Linear covariance function.

The mathematical representation is

\[f(\mathrm x_0, \mathrm x_1) = s \mathrm x_0^\intercal \mathrm x_1\]

where \(s\) is the scale parameter.

derivative_logscale(x0, x1)[source]¶

Derivative of the covariance function evaluated at (x0, x1).

Derivative of the covariance function over \(\log(s)\).

Parameters:
  • x0 (array_like) – left-hand side sample or samples.
  • x1 (array_like) – right-hand side sample or samples.
Returns:

\(s \mathrm x_0^\intercal \mathrm x_1\).
scale¶

Scale parameter.

value(x0, x1)[source]¶

Covariance function evaluated at (x0, x1).

Parameters:
  • x0 (array_like) – left-hand side sample or samples.
  • x1 (array_like) – right-hand side sample or samples.
Returns:

\(s \mathrm x_0^\intercal \mathrm x_1\).

Sum covariance¶

class limix_inference.cov.SumCov(covariances)[source]¶

Sum covariance function.

The mathematical representation is

\[f(f_0, f_1, \dots) = f_0 + f_1 + \dots\]
derivative_reduce(derivatives)[source]¶

Sum of covariance function derivatives.

Returns:\(f_0' + f_1' + \dots\)
value_reduce(values)[source]¶

Sum covariance function evaluated at (f_0, f_1, ...).

Identity covariance¶

class limix_inference.cov.EyeCov[source]¶

Identity covariance function.

The mathematical representation is

\[f(\mathrm x_0, \mathrm x_1) = s \delta[\mathrm x_0 = \mathrm x_1]\]

where \(s\) is the scale parameter and \(\delta\) is the Kronecker delta.

derivative_logscale(x0, x1)[source]¶

Derivative of the covariance function evaluated at (x0, x1).

Derivative of the covariance function over \(\log(s)\).

Parameters:
  • x0 (array_like) – left-hand side sample or samples.
  • x1 (array_like) – right-hand side sample or samples.
Returns:

\(s \delta[\mathrm x_0 = \mathrm x_1]\).
scale¶

Scale parameter.

value(x0, x1)[source]¶

Covariance function evaluated at (x0, x1).

Parameters:
  • x0 (array_like) – left-hand side sample or samples.
  • x1 (array_like) – right-hand side sample or samples.
Returns:

\(s \delta[\mathrm x_0 = \mathrm x_1]\).
